metadata.subject: Xi Jinping, China and the Global Order: The Significance of China's 2018 Central Foreign Policy Work Conference

organizations: Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy

relationships.description: Xi Jinping is General Secretary of the Party and Chairman of the Central Military Commission
Analysis of shifting global power dynamics between China and the US
Former Australian Prime Minister analyzing Chinese foreign policy

analysis.purpose: To analyze and explain the significance of China's 2018 Central Foreign Policy Work Conference and its implications for global order
analysis.significance: Provides expert analysis of China's strategic shift in foreign policy under Xi Jinping and its implications for global governance

notable_quotes: "The 2014 iteration represented the formal, official funeral of Deng Xiaoping's international policy dictum of the previous 30 years of 'hide your strength, bide your time, never take the lead'."

"Xi Jinping intends for the party to defy the trend-line of Western history, to see off Fukuyama's end of history with the inevitable triumph of Western liberal-democratic capitalism and to preserve a Leninist state for the long term."

"China to 'lead the reform of the global governance system with the concepts of fairness and justice.' This is by far the most direct, unqualified and expansive statement on China's intentions on this important question we have seen."

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this analytical speech

illegal_activity.description: Document is an analytical speech about Chinese foreign policy with no illegal activity discussed

public_knowledge.context: This is a public speech by a former Australian Prime Minister analyzing Chinese foreign policy, delivered at a prestigious academic institution and likely intended for public dissemination

analysis.summary: This speech by former Australian Prime Minister Kevin Rudd analyzes China's 2018 Central Foreign Policy Work Conference, highlighting Xi Jinping's shift toward more assertive global leadership, increased ideological emphasis in foreign policy, and China's ambition to reform global governance systems. Rudd identifies this as a significant departure from China's previous 'hide your strength' approach and predicts increased Chinese diplomatic activism.
